question.title: Cut The Paper
question.content:
You are given a paper with dimension N * M. Your task is to find the minimum number of squares in which you can cut the given paper.

Note:

1. Square is a quadrilateral whose all four sides are of equal length.
2. If the given paper is already a square then it is possible to cut the whole square in one move.
Input Format:
The first line of the input contains an integer T, denoting the number of test cases.

The first line of each test case consists of two space-separated integers N and M denoting the dimensions of the given paper, in a separate line.
Output Format:
For each test case return, the minimum number of squares in which you can cut the given paper.
Note:
You don't have to print anything, it has already been taken care of. Just Implement the given function.
Constraints:
1<= T <= 50
1<= N, M <= 150

Time Limit: 1 sec.
Sample Input 1:
1
2 3
Sample Output 1:
3
Explanation of sample input 1:
We can cut one square with side 2 and two squares with side 1.
Sample Input 2:
1
13 11
Sample Output 2:
6
Explanation of sample input 2:

As given in the picture we can cut 5 squares out of paper with dimension 13*11.

rephrased.body: Given a rectangular paper of dimensions N x M, determine the minimum number of squares into which the paper can be cut. A square is a quadrilateral with all four sides of equal length. If the paper is already a square, the answer is 1.

testcases.explanation: A paper of size 2x3 can be cut into one 2x2 square and two 1x1 squares, requiring a minimum of 3 squares.
A paper of size 13x11 can be optimally cut into a minimum of 6 squares.

hints: Try all possible ways to cut the paper.
